label: 本家
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Guarantor or protector of a shōen. The highest ranking shōen office held by only the highest ranking aristocrats or greatest religious institutions. (See Mass, Kamakura Bakufu) Some shōen had both a honke and a ryōke, a similar hgih-ranking proprietor. In such cases, one of the two took the nengu and established control. As a general term of familial relationship, the main house in an extended lineage, with power or authority over the branches (bunke). [荘園、領家、年貢、分家]
